intro: Lotononis rogersii, commonly known as the Rogers' lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
